com.sap.cloud.sdk.cloudplatform.tenant

Interface TenantFacade

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTenantFacade, ScpCfTenantFacade, ScpNeoTenantFacade

    public interface TenantFacade
    Facade interface encapsulating the logic to access Tenant information.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Tenant getCurrentTenant()
      Returns the current Tenant.
      Optional<Tenant> getCurrentTenantIfAvailable()
      Returns the current Tenant, if available.
      Class<? extends Tenant> getTenantClass()
      Returns the platform-specific implementation class of Tenant.
      Optional<Tenant> resolveCurrentTenant()
      Resolves the current Tenant using the platform-specific lookup.

    • Method Detail

      • getTenantClass

        @Nonnull
Class<? extends Tenant> getTenantClass()
        Returns the platform-specific implementation class of Tenant. For internal use only.
        Returns:
        The type of the platform-specific implementation.

      • resolveCurrentTenant

        @Nonnull
Optional<Tenant> resolveCurrentTenant()
                                        throws TenantAccessException
        Resolves the current Tenant using the platform-specific lookup. For more details on the availability of a tenant, refer to getCurrentTenantIfAvailable().

        For internal use only.

        Caution: This method must only be invoked within the container-managed thread of a request.

        Returns:
        An Optional of the current Tenant.
        Throws:
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while resolving the Tenant.
        See Also:
        TenantRequestContextListener

      • getCurrentTenantIfAvailable

        @Nonnull
Optional<Tenant> getCurrentTenantIfAvailable()
                                               throws TenantAccessException
        Returns the current Tenant, if available.

        The availability of the tenant is defined as follows:

        Tenant available Tenant not available
        SAP Cloud Platform Cloud Foundry A request is present with an "Authorization" header that contains a valid JWT bearer with field "zid". A request is not available or no "Authorization" header is present in the current request.
        SAP Cloud Platform Neo Successful JNDI lookup of TenantContext. Never. If correctly configured, a TenantContext is always available. If not, a TenantAccessException is thrown.
        Returns:
        An Optional of the current Tenant.
        Throws:
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the Tenant.

      • getCurrentTenant

        @Nonnull
Tenant getCurrentTenant()
                          throws TenantNotAvailableException,
                                 TenantAccessException
        Returns the current Tenant.
        Returns:
        The current Tenant.
        Throws:
        TenantNotAvailableException - If there is currently no Tenant available. This typically occurs when trying to access the tenant within code that is running outside any tenant context, e.g., within a background task. For more details on how the availability of a tenant is defined, refer to getCurrentTenantIfAvailable().
        TenantAccessException - If there is an issue while accessing the Tenant.
